DataElement.preferredName: Serious Adverse Event Communicated to Investigators Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that represents whether the Serious Adverse Event was communicated to other investigators using the investigational agent.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product o procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is this SAE to be communicate
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this SAE to be communicated to other investigators using this investigational agent?
